name: Jemuran: Color Guard #3
description:
This series was taken when I travelled to Singapore in Dec 2019. I finally found something in common between me, a middle-class Indonesian, and this not-underdeveloped country: hanging laundry outside Singaporean’s apartment window. 

Washing your own laundry and put them in a clothline to sun-dry them is not only meant to save money for those who are struggling to even pay their room rent, but also a work of arranging and occupying their available tiny space. 

As for me, doing my own laundry has always been meditative, in this Jemuran: Color Guard series, I mirrored the pic and put them together to form geometry (a simple mandala) from a repetitive shape.
